intro: Phacelia dubia, commonly known as the desert phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Phacelia dubia is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
